Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
CAN: The student can draw a simple outline of a fish without detailed features (e.g., basic fish shape like an oval with a triangle tail).
The student can include a body of water in the picture (such as drawing a wavy line to indicate water).
CANNOT: The student can't accurately label any part of the fish or habitat (e.g., labels missing or incorrect like calling water 'grass').
The student is unable to show other living things accurately in the habitat (e.g., plants drawn above water surface with no lines connecting to water).
The student fails to label the resources a fish needs to survive (e.g., missing or vague such as saying 'needs air').
The student does not demonstrate any relationships between the fish and its habitat (e.g., fish is floating above the water line with no indicators of interaction).
There is no representation of the fish, habitat, and other elements working together as a system (e.g., multiple elements drawn but no apparent interactions or connections).
